publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4143 Dr Elaine Murray: Congratulations to Dumfries and Galloway Council—That the Parliament congratulates Dumfries and Galloway Council on being one of eight councils in the United Kingdom named by the Association of Public Service Excellence (APSE) for the quality of its parks and open spaces; notes that it is the only Scottish council to receive this commendation on this occasion; notes also that this is the first time Dumfries and Galloway Council has been named in the APSE list, and applauds the hard work of local staff which has resulted in this recognition.
S2M-4143 Congratulations to Dumfries and Galloway Council (lodged on 20 March 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-4143 Congratulations to Dumfries and Galloway Council (lodged on 20 March 2006) Karen Gillon*, Murray Tosh*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Robin Harper*
S2M-4143 Congratulations to Dumfries and Galloway Council (lodged on 20 March 2006) Jackie Baillie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Eleanor Scott*

S2M-4143 Dr Elaine Murray: Congratulations to Dumfries and Galloway Council—That the Parliament congratulates Dumfries and Galloway Council on being one of eight councils in the United Kingdom named by the Association of Public Service Excellence (APSE) for the quality of its parks and open spaces; notes that it is the only Scottish council to receive this commendation on this occasion; notes also that this is the first time Dumfries and Galloway Council has been named in the APSE list, and applauds the hard work of local staff which has resulted in this recognition. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Karen Gillon, Murray Tosh, Mr Frank McAveety, Robin Harper, Jackie Baillie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Eleanor Scott, Scott Barrie*, Dr Jean Turner*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-4143 Congratulations to Dumfries and Galloway Council (lodged on 20 March 2006) Alasdair Morgan* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
